intro: Pedicularis collettii, commonly known as the yellow monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, often on slopes or cliffs. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptation make it a notable species in high-altitude flora.
